medical_history.chief_complaint: Ophthalmological examination due to congenital abnormalities and visual impairment.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was born at term (37 weeks and 5 days gestational age) and was noted to have multiple congenital abnormalities at birth. Ophthalmological issues were first noted at age 7 months with mild telecanthus and pigment mottling in the macula. Follow-up at 1 year and 2 years showed similar changes, and at 5 years, the patient presented with visual acuity of 20/200 in the right eye and 20/160 in the left eye.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has had multiple congenital abnormalities since birth including syndactyly, an imperforate anus, tethered spinal cord, and has undergone several surgeries to address these issues.
medical_history.family_history: Family history was unremarkable, and the parents denied consanguinity.
